DOC.brief_summary: Rates overweight obesity increase , particularly among individual age 18 29 . An estimated 25-35 % American college university student overweight obese . Contingency Management ( CM ) behavioral intervention provide tangible reward positive behavior . CM substantial evidence efficacy reduce smoke drug use increase treatment retention medication compliance . The current study evaluate efficacy 24-week CM intervention promote weight loss overweight obese university student . Seventy participant body mass index ( BMI ) 27.0-34.9 randomly assign one two condition : ( ) LEARN , manual guide behavioral weight loss program ( Brownell , 2004 ) , weigh-ins supportive counseling , ( b ) LEARN weigh-ins supportive counseling plus CM . Participants CM condition earn chance win prizes week lose least one pound . Once lose 5 % baseline body weight , earn chance win prizes weight loss weight maintenance . Additional chance earn complete activity promote weight loss . The primary outcome absolute proportional weight loss pre- post-treatment , well proportion participant achieve clinically significant weight loss ( > 5 % baseline weight ) proportion move low risk BMI category . Secondary outcome include length retention study , increase physical activity level , improvement nutritional quality diet . Effects CM intervention psychiatric distress self-efficacy motivation engage activity promote weight loss also assess . We predict participant CM condition lose weight participant assign LEARN program without CM , CM participant achieve clinically significant weight loss . We also predict participant CM condition remain program longer , show large increase physical activity , show great improvement diet quality , great increase level self-efficacy motivation comparison group participant . Mediators moderator CM outcome also evaluate . If efficacious promote weight loss college population , CM could help prevent delay later development obesity-related medical problem .
DOC.brief_title: Contingency Management Promoting Weight Loss University Students
DOC.criteria: currently enrol undergraduate graduate student age 17 29 year body mass index kg/m2 ( BMI ) 27.0 39.9 rest blood pressure 90140 ( systolic ) 6090 ( diastolic ) mmHg willingness ability participate 24 week date enrollment willingness randomly assign one two group serious acute chronic medical problem ( e.g . diabetes mellitus , heart disease , cancer , asthma , back joint problem , hernia , history recent surgery ) pregnant breast feed current , uncontrolled psychiatric condition serious psychiatric symptom ( e.g . current suicidality , psychotic symptom meet criterion substance dependence disorder , ( 5 ) report daily tobacco use report history past current eating disorder recovery pathological gamble report lose 10 % heavy body weight last 6 month report participation formal weight loss program last 6 month .
